name: Dog Breeds in the Terrier Group Quiz | Animals | 10 Questions

questions.text: One of the breeds most recently admitted into the AKC (as of Jan. 2001) was this terrier, bred by an English churchman to hunt foxes.
questions.explanation:
Parson Russell terrier.

	An incredibly active dog who needs LOTS of training and exercise- not an ideal pet for most people!

questions.text: This red terrier is known for his rollicking temperament and love for a scrap with other dogs.
questions.explanation:
Irish terrier.

	Fairly large for a terrier.

questions.text: 'Petey' of the Little Rascals was a registered example of this breed.
questions.explanation:
American Pit Bull Terrier.

	Most registries register these dogs as American Pit Bull Terriers. The same dog can be registered as an American Staffordshire Terrier with the American Kennel Club and as an American Pit Bull Terrier with the United Kennel Club, the second oldest kennel club in America.

questions.text: This terrier, with its topknot and large eyes, was named after a character in a novel by Sir Walter Scott.
questions.explanation:
Dandie Dinmont terrier.

	From the novel 'Guy Mannering' written by Sir Walter Scott.

questions.text: This breed has won Best in Show at Westminster more than any other, in the 20th century.
questions.explanation:
Wire fox terrier.

	The show dogs are meticulously groomed, unlike the average scruffy pet.

questions.text: Fala, Franklin Delano Roosevelt's beloved companion, was of this breed.
questions.explanation:
Scottish terrier.

	Scotties are independent, proud and scrappy.

questions.text: This terrier breed is groomed to resemble a lamb.
questions.explanation:
Bedlington terrier.

	The Bedlington terrier was once a poor man's ratter.

questions.text: This is the largest breed of terrier.
questions.explanation:
Airedale terrier.

	This is a very tough and loyal dog, which has been used for everything from bear hunting to search and rescue.

questions.text: This breed is most well-known for a starring appearance in the movie 'The Wizard of Oz'.
questions.explanation:
Cairn terrier.

	The cairn is also one of the milder terriers in temperament.

questions.text: What country did almost all AKC-recognized terriers originate in?
questions.explanation:
Great Britain.

	All except the American Staffordshire Terrier, Miniature Schnauzer, and Australian Terrier originated in Great Britain.
